text: Lanchyn (, , , ) is an urban-type settlement in Nadvirna Raion in Ivano- Frankivsk Oblast. Its population was . == Location == Lanchyn is located on the Prut about 42 kilometers south of Ivano-Frankivsk and 16 kilometers southeast of Nadvirna. == History == Between 1772 and 1918 it was part of Austrian Galicia. After the end of World War I Lanchyn (as Łanczyn) became part of Nadvirna Powiat in Stanisławów Voivodeship, part of Poland. In 1939 it was annexed by the Soviet Union. In 1940 it became an urban-type settlement. Lanchyn was occupied by German troops during World War II from 1941 to 1944, part of the District of Galicia. Postwar, Lanchyn was briefly the center of the raion. == Notable people == * Mykhajlo Levitsky, Metropolitan of Lviv == References == Category:Populated places on the Prut Category:Stanisławów Voivodeship Category:Urban-type settlements in Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast Category:Shtetls Category:Holocaust locations in Ukraine
title: Lanchyn
